element.name: DESCRIPTION
element.text:
This algorithm calculates the mean center and the standard distance, creating a new layer with a circle centered on the mean center and with radius equal to the standard distance.
The Mean center is the spatial equivalent of the mean value, and represents the point nearest to all the input points, on average. Points can be weighed. If, for instance, points represent cities, they can be weighed using the population of each city. In this case, the mean center would be the point nearest to all the inhabitants of the region, on average.
The standard distance is the spatial equivalent of the standard deviation.

image.description: calculated standard distance in the mean center.

element.name: FIELD
element.text: Field to use for weighing points

element.name: METHOD
element.text: the following options are available * Mean center: all points have the same weight * Weighted mean center: weights are assigned using the selected field

element.name: RESULT
element.text: A layer with a circle radius equal to standard distance and centered in the geographic mean center. The attributes table contains a single field, with the standard deviation.
